page.title: 05TRANSPORT IN KENDAL
page.content: Traffic in Kendal used to be so heavy that in{1968}Kendal's notorious {one-way system}was introduced. People travelling to the{Lakes}and especially {Windermere}did not like this. The{M6 was built in{October 1970,}the Kendal by-pass was built in{August 1971}and Kendal{Link Road}in{March 1975.}All these roads are needed to combat the steady summer traffic through Kendal Town Centre. From a small survey we found that{580 vehicles left Kendal in an hour and {444}vehicles entered Kendal.Out of these figures{80%}were cars and the other{20%}were buses and vans. The survey, carried out on the North and South sides of Kendal also showed that{360}out of{1024}cars,ie{35.1% were purchased locally (the Kendal area). This gives some indication of tourist traffic.
